    • Method Detail

      • getRecentArticles

        public List<Object> getRecentArticles(Site site,
                             int articleCount,
                             double numberOfDaysAgo,
                             boolean shuffle,
                             List<String> articleTypes)
                               throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: RecentArticleService
        Query for recent articles.
        Specified by:
        getRecentArticles in interface RecentArticleService
        Parameters:
        site - The site on which to display the articles. Articles will be filtered for this site's journal.
        articleCount - The number of articles to find. Unless there are fewer total articles in the journal, the returned list is guaranteed to be exactly this size.
        numberOfDaysAgo - The size in days of the "time window" to query. Find articles whose publication date is after this many days before present system time. If not enough articles have been published in the window to fulfill articleCount, go beyond the window in chronological order to find enough articles.
        shuffle - Whether to randomly select and reorder results. If true, and the number of articles published in the time window is greater than articleCount, select a random subset numbering articleCount and return them in a random order. If false, keep them in chronological order and truncate down to articleCount. Ignored if the number of articles published in the time window does not exceed articleCount.
        articleTypes - The article types to return, in order of preference. If enough articles of these types have been published in the time window to fulfill articleCount, they are sorted by type in this order, then in chronological order. If the query went beyond the time window, the order is ignored and the results are sorted in chronological order. The string "*" means "all article types".
        Returns:
        the list of results
        Throws:
        IOException
